question_text: Which of the following are valid troubleshooting steps when dealing with recurring spooler crashes? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Monitor the Print Service log in Windows Event Viewer
Update the printer's IP address to dynamic
Delete stuck jobs from the print queue
correct_answer: Monitor the Print Service log in Windows Event Viewer
Delete stuck jobs from the print queue
explanation: Driver issues, job corruption, and logged spooler errors are primary root causes. Changing IP or orientation has no direct impact on spooler service behavior.
